diseases.name: Foot and Mouth Disease
diseases.description: A highly contagious viral disease that affects cloven-hoofed animals like cattle, pigs, and sheep.
symptoms: Blisters on the mouth and feet

diseases.name: Bovine Tuberculosis
diseases.description: A chronic bacterial infection that primarily affects cattle, but can also affect other animals and humans.

diseases.name: Avian Influenza (Bird Flu)
diseases.description: A viral infection that affects birds, especially poultry. It can be transmitted to humans in rare cases.
symptoms: Swelling of the head, neck, and eyes

diseases.name: African Swine Fever
diseases.description: A viral disease affecting pigs, causing high mortality rates. It does not affect humans.

diseases.name: Lumpy Skin Disease (LSD)
diseases.symptoms: Firm raised skin nodules up to 50mm in diameter develop around the head, neck, genitals and limbs. Nodules can develop on any part of the body.
diseases.treatment: developing and implementing an integrated insect management plan

diseases.name: Anthrax
diseases.symptoms:
1.Chest pain and trouble breathing.
2.Fatigue.
3.Fever and profuse sweating.
4.Headache or muscle aches.
5.Itchy blisters or bumps.
6.Skin ulcer (sore) with a black center.
7.Nausea and vomiting, abdominal pain and bloody diarrhea.
8.Swollen lymph nodes.

diseases.name: Newcastle Disease (ND)
diseases.symptoms:
respiratory distress,
 neurological signs,
 digestive issues,
 reduced egg production
diseases.treatment: use antibiotics to prevent secondary infections, and vaccination to prevent future outbreaks, are crucial.

diseases.name: Rabies
diseases.symptoms: tingling, prickling, or itching feeling around the bite area
diseases.treatment: Once a rabies infection is established, there's no effective treatment. Though a small number of people have survived rabies, the disease usually causes death. For that reason, if you think you've been exposed to rabies, you must get a series of shots to prevent the infection from taking hold.
